instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Was  a slight water damage board on magsafe side.  Had to replace the magesafe and flat cable.  the air turns on with green/orange light, but does not find battery in the os.  where do i start with this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: PPBUS voltage without battery? Diode mode on both battery data lines? I assume you tried a known good battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
ppbus without batery- 8.17v

diode mode battery connection:
1-2.87v
2-2.91
3-2.93
4-2.7
5-2.7
6-ol


yes known good battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: PPBUS on 8.17 means SMC is not helping on regulation..  This could be a bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and/or bad SMC, those diode mode readings seems wrong, remember, red probe to ground black probe to teh test point, DMM set in diode mode..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> same ppbus readings

red point to ground test batt test point

1-3 ol
4-5 - .533
6 ol
7-9 ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
okay. reflowed smc and now have ppbus at 8.58v

when os is booted up, the battery icon disappears and when you unplug magsafe it goes to sleep, not automatically powering off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
when os is booted up, the battery icon disappears and when you unplug magsafe it goes to [URL="http://wikipedia.org"]sleep[/URL], not automatically powering off.

I noticed that it says battery is 0%

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: any message on battery status??? Also try another battery...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
this is whats happening. the battery icon will not display on top bar. it says 0% and when you click on show battery in menu bar it goes away right away.  also if you unplug the charger it goes to sleep. here is link

[URL="https://www.dropbox.com/s/v4bp8tt1kdzrdjj/20180214_153039%5B1%5D.mp4?dl=0"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/v4bp8tt1kd...B1%5D.mp4?dl=0[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Go to About this mac----> System information---> Power, what says about battery there???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: If that's the original battery, that battery is totally fucked. Is that your tester or no?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: have you tried a known good battery??? Diode mode on battery data lines, without power applied of course...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
yes i have multiple batteries.  diode mode is already posted.


1-3 ol
4-5 - .533
6 ol
7-9 ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
It is still not properly recognizing the battery. Could be bad battery or still SMC problem. If there was corrosion around battery connector there could also be crap under the connector.
Sleeping issue is probably IO board and/or flex cable, the usual.
